intro: Silene gypsophiloides, commonly known as the rock pink, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and showy, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Its flowers are often clustered in racemes and bloom in the spring or early summer. Silene gypsophiloides is known for its ability to thrive in harsh conditions, making it a resilient and hardy species.
